Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as ba498310f761b3c0f475ecbdb293cf1386544a33
I see no usage of the "replace" enumeration.  Maybe something that is no longer needed?
That was part of downstream code, which shouldn't appear here at all. Removed.
Done
This doesn't seem right to put an empty value?
Restored verify function to original shape, without optional parameters. IMO this introduced unnecessary complications to the code.
Done
same here.
Restored verify function to original shape, without optional parameters. IMO this introduced unnecessary complications to the code.
Done
This needs to return some kind of error.  Generally we would return empty string then check for that when this function is called.
We translate specific redfish messages, for all others dbusMessage is the same as redfish. We don't need to return them

> for all others dbusMessage is the same as redfish

Given that dbus enumerations are namespaced with xyz.openbmc_project.Enum.Value

There's no way they can be the same unless there's a bug in the backend.

Please fix this code to return an error.

Messages we're getting back from backend don't point to enums, but rather for specific property names. Is it necessary for them to have full namespaced name as well
(e.g. `xyz.openbmc_project.Telemetry.Report.ReportingType` instead of just `ReportingType`)?

If so, then backend indeed would need adjustments + this function would need to be extended for handling all property names as all of them would then differ from ther Redfish counterparts.

Regardless of how they're namespaced, we need to explicitly call out all the options here, to make it clear how the conversion works.  Otherwise if telemetry service adds an option that's not in redfish, we have the potential to cause problems.
Done
Lets separate out this logic a bit.  If we get an error that doesn't have an appropriate length, that becomes a messages::internalError.  As is this code just ignores it.

We don't wan't InternlError because then we can't check errorMessage with other parameters. And we compare size to be sure the errorMessage returns what we looking for instead "propertyName.something_else"

> We don't wan't InternlError because then we can't check errorMessage with other parameters.

We're receiving a bad dbus interface, which is an error the user can do nothing about.  The correct error is internal error 500.

> And we compare size to be sure the errorMessage returns what we looking for instead "propertyName.something_else"

That's fine, but we need to be comparing error messages correctly.
I've added a comment which will relate to this in the one regarding including array index in error.
Done
This looks like it's only ever used with type string.  You might also consider changing from std::vector to std::span.
This needs more changes, starting in struct AddReportArgs. Other functions are using it as vector and add data to this vector. If its needed can be added in other patch in future

> This needs more changes, starting in struct AddReportArgs. Other functions are using it as vector and add data to this vector. If its needed can be added in other patch in future

Please make the code correct and as simple as it can be for the functions provided.  If this needs to be a template in a future patch, we can discuss when that patch is pushed.
Actually, there's a second type used here, which is `nlohman::json::object_t`. That's why template needs to stay. Changed parameter to std::span.

we're passing span<string> and span<object_t> ?

Could we just pass this as a nlohmann::json::array_t?
Done

For array values, we would generally point to the index in the array that caused the problem

ie, MyArray/1

It's actually not that trivial. If backend returns back an error, it means there's a more generalized problem with an array, not specific to any of its member (e.g. item count being too big).

From what I saw, if problem's with an object, backend might point out which field causes failure after a dot. This however seems to be a dead code, as I've never been able to force that behavior. I'm considering removing that code, which would simplify the handler here: we would remove that `>= key.size()` check and simply do a strict comparison between errorMessage and key.
Done
Common error.
please move toRedfishProperty to its own line
Done
Done
Done
Done
do we really need both structs here?  They differ in only minor ways.
Agreed, I've removed the second structure and extended the original one with fields for Redfish values for certain enums.
Done
common error.
Done
Done

Hi @Ed,
I've taken over this patch after Eryk and pushed some fixes. Could You please take a look?

Since this patch was last updated, there's a whole new host of generic error handling in the form of the setDbusProperty helper functions:

https://github.com/openbmc/bmcweb/blob/4ed30a8b4c93bbae2362ceffba41abb60a11ab6b/redfish-core/include/utils/dbus_utils.hpp#L50

It would help quite a bit with the review if this code change were able to use those.

I think this can be done for the PATCH handler, where update is indeed done by setting dbus properties. That won't be achievable for adding report though, as it is done through method call.

Do You want to follow this trace in this patch or would You rather like to merge this first and then do the refactor in the next patch?
Lets get this patch merged first.
This code is really hard to read and understand.  Please fix it.
Done

This looks really odd, propertyValueIncorrect takes a nlohmann::json&, so you're taking the array, converting it to a string, then converting the string back to a nlohmann object?

array -> string -> nlohmann

why not just go

array -> nlohmann?
Done

Why are we converting this into a json array just to handle error messages?  

Just make a new function similar to verifyParameterArray that handles the type of args.metrics
Done
This lambda is far longer than what we allow for new code anymore.
Done
Why is this "Id"  We're not setting anything called Id here.  Shouldn't this be Enabled?  Can't we just hardcode this as a single message instead of calling a generic helper function?
Done
Suspect this is incorrect.
Done
?  Delete shouldn't fail on an ID param.  No id was provided to the function.  This should be something like not found, right?
Done

I've updated this patch with something that I think can merge.  If you're ok with it, I think this can go.  Please review the two prior commits, which break out some of the refactor-only parts into their own patches.

If we want to continue to push with what was there previously, we can continue to iterate, but lets just get this done and move onto the next hard problem.

I'm still seeing some error handling that's in correct around POST.  Creating a MEtricReportDefinition with the wrong parameters, results in a ResourceNotFound error.

I'm not sure if that's related to the changes made in this patch, or if they were working before and I broke them.

Regardless, lets just get this on master so we can iterate.
At first glance it seems that dbus call simply returns EBADR. Have You confirmed that telemetry service is running? I wasn't able to replicate this problem on my side.
As suggested, I've extended this with all possible values we can get from backend for now. If there's no match, empty string is returned, which will lead to internal error.
This needs to go after checking for invalid argument. Otherwise we'll go straight into internal error. I've applied that here and for the remaining cases as well.
